data.content:
verb
plunks; plunked; plunking
informal
chiefly US :to pull or hit a string or key on a musical instrument with your fingers especially in a way that makes a brief, somewhat harsh sound [+ obj]
You've been plunking that banjo all afternoon!
She plunked out a little tune on the piano. [no obj]
plunking away on a guitar
[+ obj] US :to hit (someone or something) especially with a ball
The pitcher plunked the first two batters of the game.
always followed by an adverb or preposition [+ obj] chiefly US :to drop or place (something or someone) in a forceful and often careless way :plop
He plunked [=(Brit) plonked] the suitcase onto the bench.
She plunked a mug of coffee on the counter. - often used figuratively
He was plunked down into a job he wasn't qualified to do.
plunk down
[phrasal verb] informal
plunk down (money) or plunk (money) down US :to pay or spend (money)
He just plunked down $25,000 for a new car.
plunk down or plunk yourself down chiefly US :to sit or lie down suddenly in a careless way
He plunked down [=(Brit) plonked down] beside me.
She plunked herself down on the sofa.

Danh từ, Phó từ, Động từ
xem plonk
data.type: Danh từ, Phó từ, Động từ
